quote.text: Then was Jesus led up of the spirit into the wilderness to be tempted of the devil.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And when he had fasted forty days and forty nights, he was afterward an hungred.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And when the tempter came to him, he said, If thou be the Son of God, command that these stones be made bread.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: But he answered and said, It is written, Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that proceedeth out of the mouth of God.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Then the devil taketh him up into the holy city, and setteth him on a pinnacle of the temple,
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And saith unto him, If thou be the Son of God, cast thyself down: for it is written, He shall give his angels charge concerning thee: and in their hands they shall bear thee up, lest at any time thou dash thy foot against a stone.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Jesus said unto him, It is written again, Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Again, the devil taketh him up into an exceeding high mountain, and sheweth him all the kingdoms of the world, and the glory of them;
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And saith unto him, All these things will I give thee, if thou wilt fall down and worship me.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Then saith Jesus unto him, Get thee hence, Satan: for it is written, Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and him only shalt thou serve.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Then the devil leaveth him, and, behold, angels came and ministered unto him.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: Now when Jesus had heard that John was cast into prison, he departed into Galilee;
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And leaving Nazareth, he came and dwelt in Capernaum, which is upon the sea coast, in the borders of Zabulon and Nephthalim:
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Esaias the prophet, saying,
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: The land of Zabulon, and the land of Nephthalim, by the way of the sea, beyond Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles;
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: The people which sat in darkness saw great light; and to them which sat in the region and shadow of death light is sprung up.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: From that time Jesus began to preach, and to say, Repent: for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And Jesus, walking by the sea of Galilee, saw two brethren, Simon called Peter, and Andrew his brother, casting a net into the sea: for they were fishers.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And he saith unto them, Follow me, and I will make you fishers of men.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And they straightway left their nets, and followed him.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And going on from thence, he saw other two brethren, James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, in a ship with Zebedee their father, mending their nets; and he called them.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And they immediately left the ship and their father, and followed him.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And Jesus went about all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing all manner of sickness and all manner of disease among the people.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And his fame went throughout all Syria: and they brought unto him all sick people that were taken with divers diseases and torments, and those which were possessed with devils, and those which were lunatick, and those that had the palsy; and he healed them.
quote.author: Matthew

quote.text: And there followed him great multitudes of people from Galilee, and from Decapolis, and from Jerusalem, and from Judaea, and from beyond Jordan.
quote.author: Matthew
